website_summaries.verdict: Versatile machine that'll get the job done for you when stringing tennis rackets at home.
pros: Mounting system is easy to use and can be adjusted quickly, allowing you to finish the job in a short amount of time
Includes a few tools that you'll need to string your own rackets, as well as a storage tray
Surprising performance and quality level, considering its price
cons: Not designed for a busy tennis racket stringing business

customer_reviews.title: Worth a shot even for new stringers..
customer_reviews.text: A good equipment for stringing that is easy to use and quick to learn for new users as well. Have to initially remember to position the racket and the 4 side holders well secured else might cause issues. Stable and strong in its structure. Would recommend to only use it when mounted on a proper stand. The lock knob for the turn table is in an odd position and have to bend to properly see or hold it to turn and lock the table when needed. You only need it intermittently so not a show-stopper. Have successfully now done 5+ rackets in 4 weeks time since I bought. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Anand V. Chitale

customer_reviews.title: Not for badminton
customer_reviews.text: It says that it can be useful for badminton but it doesn’t have the badminton’s frame support, I broke 1 racket cuz the frame is too high so it slipped Contacted the company for requesting the right frame support but no answer so far Will wait a couple days before I decided to return the item
customer_reviews.author: Tw

customer_reviews.title: Great entry-level stringer, or for those on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I got out of the stringing game for about 25 years or so, but now I'm back and loving it. This Gamma stringer is very similar to the old green one I had of some other brand, and it's much, much better. The string grip mechanism is a major step forward. The clamps are better and less likely to damage the string than the old metal ones I used. Overall, for the price range, I think it's an awesome deal.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Dahl

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Very sturdy and holds racquets very secure ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Very sturdy and holds racquets very secure and the tension is pretty good too. definitely not for professional tournaments, but very good if you want to string your own racquets and recreational or charging friends and family for racquet stringing. directions are good, however learn about your racquets, because there are one piece racquets and two piece racquets.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Works, easy to use, and pays for itself!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Never need to visit pro shop for restring again. Easy to use and taught 10 year old to use it!
customer_reviews.author: trustedshopper

customer_reviews.title: A good stringing machine
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this one. A good stringing machine for 179. Gamma told me there is no difference between this and the x models, they only wanted to change the looks and add small drawers on the bigger models, so they came out with the X line, build and functionality its the same. Stringing learning curve is not too bad, the first one will take you some time, after that is just a simple process. It comes with tools and 3 Gamma Strings included (mine did). Quick to setup, small footprint. This one is totally worth it even if you are a club player. Stop reading reviews, get it and go out and play!!
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Guevara

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.text: Best choice for your money. Good quality stringer. All what you need start stringing your racquet is included.
customer_reviews.author: el papa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, clamps and tools work, strung 4 rackets so far with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: No bells or whistles, but works awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is a probably the best investment I’ve ever made for Tennis. It’s already paid for itself, and I’ve only had it a couple months now.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: a beautiful device to restring tennis racquet
customer_reviews.text: a beautiful device to restring tennis racquet. easy to follow and good quality. made in Taiwan, not China, I have replaced 2 racquets strings with no problem. anybody can do this. don't be afraid..
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, accurate, and worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: Worth buying if you restring a lot. It is easy to learn with a little help from You Tube, and will save you a lot of money. My local club was charging the price of the string plus $38 labor. I now restring my racket, my families rackets, and my playing partners.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Johnson

customer_reviews.title: a good product
customer_reviews.text: I cannot complain. The instruction is good. It came with six strings. It is easy to setup. It did not take me much time to set it up. Easy to use and well designed. I used the string that came with it and took about 2 hours to finish the first one. Most time spent on how to clamp the first one. Because of lack of experience, it took a while. The second took about one hour. Normal time should take about 40 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Xiaoqing Sun

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. I must have stung about 20 rackets already and no problem. I like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: BuyBuyBuy

customer_reviews.title: Very Good!
customer_reviews.text: i ordered the stringer last month and arrived to me at the exact date. the item was in good condition..great job amazon! as for the stringer, i am quite satisfied with it.easy to use and gives accurate tension on your racket. i am very happy. now i can do my string jobs on my own and improve my game a lot more. better purchase a Gamma ERT Tenniscomputer to test your preferred dynamic tension...
customer_reviews.author: Khyber Al-Hazar I. Dagbusan

customer_reviews.title: Says is easy to handle and useful product
customer_reviews.text: Husband set this up and is surely repairing his many rackets, new and old ones. Says is easy to handle and useful product.
customer_reviews.author: sedpj

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice Stringer and Good quality! Great for tournament travel. Modern features. I like the counter balance weight- A Very Good Price
customer_reviews.author: JLprt

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Socialites!
customer_reviews.text: Clamps are not that easy to work with. It's worth the price if you are just a social player.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonPrimeCustomer0114

customer_reviews.title: Had it for a year, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptic at first, but decided to take the leap since stringing my racquets took around 2 days and 50 USD out of my pocket. I still need to look at the diagrams, and off course, practice makes perfect... after around 40 stringing jobs on my Babolat Aero Pro Drive +, all I can say is I'm so glad I purchased this item. I agree it isn't probably that accurate, but for me, lvl 4-5 semi competitive recreational player, it does the job. The clamps feel a little cheap (plastic) but, somehow they've played their part so I cant really argue about that. Would totally recommend to anyone considering purchasing this stringing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mani

customer_reviews.title: Good Stringer
customer_reviews.text: Cost efficient and gets the job done. Takes a while to get used to but you can figure it out through youtube videos. I didnt even glance at the manual. strings my rackets very well and very accurate since it uses simple physics. Would reccomend to any serious tennis players
customer_reviews.author: Quan Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great cost effective stringer for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I had never strung a racket before and, after reading a number of reviews on stringers, decided to purchase this one. I used online videos to help and I successfully strung my first racket. The stringer works very well and is well designed. While it took me 2 hours for my first racket, I expect that it will go much quicker the next time. I would highly recommend this stringer for people that are stringing rackets up to several times per month. If you are stringing more often, you may want to get a higher end stringer to save time.
customer_reviews.author: jbcmass

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Watched a YouTube video of someone using the same machine and I had no problem stringing my racquet. Played with it today and the tension seemed right on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done and is easy to get use too. Easy to set up too.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A couple of things that are not perfect. The part of the stringer that holds the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first racquet stringing machine that i have used and owned. It seems to work well. Takes a little time to learn how to string a racquet if you haven't restrung one before. But after you learn how to use it, the process goes much faster. I just used Youtube videos to learn the technique. A couple of things that are not perfect. The part of the stringer that holds the string is like sandpaper and can roughen the strings on some type of strings. The free floating clamps are a little big.
customer_reviews.author: JoshuaS

customer_reviews.title: This product is so great, easy to use and really accurate to the ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is so great , easy to use and really accurate to the string tension that I set up. Really recommended to those players who play a lot and you can really save a lot money.
customer_reviews.author: Napoleon M. Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Great stringer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great stringer for the price. Don't rely on the manual on how to string, look up a youtube video instead.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Not for Head racquetball racquets
customer_reviews.text: Stringer is fine but cannot do many Head racquetball racquets. There is no locking mechanism so you cannot do cross strings. Service was good and return was processed without hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Van Marion

customer_reviews.title: This string machine is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This string machine is easy to use. I love it. Had fixed more than 10 badminton rackets. However this is a two point supports machine. I will not do over 28 lbs on badminton rackets or 64 lbs on tennis rackets
customer_reviews.author: xiaolongliu

customer_reviews.title: Great stringer- save money or make some.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this produced for over 4 years - for high school team and students. Great for travel to tournaments. My has traveled Ojai to Indian Wells and all over California. Great stringer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy well built machine.
customer_reviews.text: The progression 2 602 is a fabulous stringing machine . I highly recommend the 6 support point and floating clamp model. It makes stringing much faster and safer for racquet support and well worth the extra $150. The drop weight is very accurately calibrated. I have strung hundreds of racquets over a 10 year period with no problems. You will need to buy an optional spring loaded "starter clamp". It is very handy for tying ending knots and starting cross strings. The machine is quite heavy to lift for a tabletop model, 38 lbs.. The machine is fairly easy to use and "youtube" is probably the best source for learning how to string a racquet.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W. Moblo

customer_reviews.title: one of the best machines for a frequent string breaker!
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, portable, user friendly, and most important of all to me....it was under $200! Ive recovered my investment in this machine in just about 1 month when stringing for myself and close friends! worth the $$!
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: great price, great product
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure of buying it, but I get really surprised with its development, very simple to use and the job is great, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ceri86

product_meta.title: Gamma Progression Tennis Racquet Stringing Machine: Tabletop Racket String Machine with Tools and Accessories - Tennis, Squash and Badminton Racket Stringer
product_meta.description:
VERSATILE STRINGER
Gamma Sports has been designing and manufacturing stringing machines for more than 25 years. Whether you need a stringer for your home or business, you can trust that the Progression will be your go-to machine. This machine can be used on tennis, racquetball, squash or badminton rackets. This table top stringing machine is made to last for years and features a broad base design and diamond-coated rotational ratchet gripper.

PERFECT STRING TENSION
With the Gamma Progression, you can be sure to get the perfect string tension that matches your exact needs. Our stringing machines features a drop weight tensioning mechanism with a 9 to 90 pound range. It’s also equipped with a nickel chrome plated steel bar turntable that rotates 360 degree for maximum agility and stringing ease.

2 or 6 POINT MOUNTING
Here at Gamma Sports, we want to make racket stringing as easy and safe as possible. This stringing machine features 2 composite floating clamps and a two-point racquet mounting system or a 6-point Quick Mount System that will keep the racket firmly in place. This machine is a great entry level stringer and has the same easy-to-use features as more advanced models.

TOOL TRAY
When you’re stringing, you need to have all your tools within arm’s reach to make the process as easy and headache-free as possible. The Gamma Progression features a built-in tray designed to keep your stringing tools and accessories near you while you work. And when you’re done, just close the tray to keep your awls and other tools safe and sound so you don’t misplace them.

TOOLS INCLUDED
When you get the Gamma Progression, you’ll be ready to start stringing as soon as it arrives. Along with the stringing machine you also get a Gamma Pathfinder Awl, straight awl, hex wrenches and straight pliers with cutter. You also get 3 sets of quality Gamma tennis strings and a United States Racquets Stringer's Association Getting Started Stringing Guide.
feature_bullets: PERFECT STRING TENSION: Offers drop weight tensioning (9lb to 90lb) with a 360 steel bar turntable
6 POINT MOUNTING: Designed for easy and safe stringing that will keep your racket firmly in place
VERSATILE STRINGER: You can use this machine on tennis, racquetball, squash or badminton racquets
TOOL TRAY: Keep all your restring tools within easy reach while you work with the built-in tray
TOOL SET: Includes pathfinder awl, straight awl, hex wrenches, pliers, and diagonal cutter
